snippet: Since the toppling of Saddam Hussein, Chinese state-owned companies have poured workers and billions of dollars into Iraq to secure a steady supply of energy for China.
abstract: Chinese state-owned companies have poured workers and investment dollars into Iraq to secure steady supply of energy since the toppling of Saddam Hussein; Iraq has become one of the world's top oil producers and China is now its biggest customer.

byline.original: By TIM ARANGO and CLIFFORD KRAUSS
byline.contributor: Tim Arango reported from Baghdad, and Clifford Krauss reported from Houston.

lead_paragraph: Since the toppling of Saddam Hussein, Chinese state-owned companies have poured workers and billions of dollars into Iraq to secure a steady supply of energy for China.

headline.seo: China Reaps Biggest Benefits of Iraq Oil Boom
headline.main: China Is Reaping Biggest Benefits of Iraq Oil Boom
headline.print_headline: China Is Reaping Biggest Benefits of Iraq Oil Boom
